sen.j: 大炊寮（おおいりょう）とは日本の律令制において宮内省に属する機関の一つである。
sen.e: Oiryo is a bureau of the Ministry of the Imperial Household under the ritsuryo system in Japan.
Oiryo (Bureau of Palace Kitchens) is a bureau of Kunaisho (the Ministry of the Imperial Household) under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.
sen.cmt: Oiryo、ritsuryo systemの補足追加 (用語集参照)、Kunaisho (the Ministry of the Imperial Household)としました。
sen.e: Oiryo (Bureau of Palace Kitchens) is a bureau of Kunaisho (the Ministry of the Imperial Household) under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.

sen.j: 大炊とは大飯炊（おおいかしぐ）の略称といわれる。
sen.e: Oi is said to be an abbreviated name of oikashigu.
Oi is said to be an abbreviated name of oikashigu.
Oi is said to be an abbreviated name of oikashigu.

sen.j: 職掌
sen.e: Official capacity
Official capacity
Official capacity

sen.j: 宮中で行われる仏事、神事の供物、宴会での宴席の準備、管理を分掌する。
sen.e: The bureau was responsible for food preparation for Buddhist and Shinto ceremonies and feasts in the court and food management.
The bureau was responsible for food preparation for Buddhist and Shinto ceremonies and feasts in the court and food management.
The bureau was responsible for food preparation for Buddhist and Shinto ceremonies and feasts in the court and food management.

sen.j: また、御料地の管理も行った。
sen.e: It also managed the Imperial demesnes.
It also managed the Imperial demesnes.
It also managed the Imperial demesnes.

sen.j: 平安時代以降､頭は中原氏が世襲した。
sen.e: Beginning in the Heian period, kami (the head) was inherited by the Nakahara clan.
Beginning in the Heian period, kami (the head) was inherited by the Nakahara clan.
Beginning in the Heian period, kami (the head) was inherited by the Nakahara clan.

sen.j: 職員
sen.e: Officials
Personnel
Personnel

sen.j: 頭（従五位下相当）一名
sen.e: One kami (equivalent to junior fifth rank, lower grade)
One kami (equivalent to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade])
sen.cmt: 従五位下の表記を修正
sen.e: One kami (equivalent to Jugoinoge [Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade])

sen.j: 助（従六位上相当）一名
sen.e: One suke (equivalent to junior sixth rank, upper grade)
sen.cmt: 従六位が重複していたので削除、上を追加
sen.e: One suke (equivalent to Jurokuinojo [Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade])
sen.cmt: 従六位上の表記を修正
sen.e: One suke (equivalent to Jurokuinojo [Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade])

sen.j: 允（従七位上相当）一名
sen.e: One jo (equivalent to junior seventh, upper grade)
sen.cmt: 従六位を削除、上を追加
sen.e: One jo (equivalent to Jushichiinojo [Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade])
sen.cmt: 従七位上の表記を修正
sen.e: One jo (equivalent to Jushichiinojo [Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade])

sen.j: 大属（従八位下相当）一名
sen.e: One daisakan (equivalent to junior eighth, lower grade)
sen.cmt: 従六位を削除、下を追加
sen.e: One daisakan (equivalent to Juhachiinoge [Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade])
sen.cmt: 従八位下の表記を修正
sen.e: One daisakan (equivalent to Juhachiinoge [Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade])

sen.j: 少属（大初位上相当）一名
sen.e: One shosakan (equivalent to greater initial rank, upper grade)
sen.cmt: 従六位を削除、上を追加
sen.e: One shosakan (equivalent to Daihatsuinojo [Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade])
sen.cmt: 大初位上の表記を修正
sen.e: One shosakan (equivalent to Daihatsuinojo [Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade])

sen.j: 大炊部 炊飯・米の出納を行う官人雑色人
sen.e: Oibe are zoshikinin who cook rice and manage rice stores.
Oibe were zoshikinin (lower-level functionaries in the provincial government) who cooked rice and manage rice stores.
sen.cmt: are→were、cook→cookedに修正、zoshikininの補足追加 (用語集)
sen.e: Oibe were zoshikinin (lower-level functionaries in the provincial government) who cooked rice and manage rice stores.

sen.j: 官人雑任 新設
sen.e: Kanninzonin is a new post.
Kanninzonin (lower-ranking government official) was a new post.
sen.cmt: Kanninzoninの補足追加 (用語集)、is→wasに修正
sen.e: Kanninzonin (lower-ranking government official) was a new post.

sen.j: 使部
sen.e: Tsukaibe
Tsukaibe (low rank bureaucrats)
Tsukaibe (low rank bureaucrats)

sen.j: 官人仕丁
sen.e: Kanninshicho
Kanninshicho (a manservant doing odd jobs)
Kanninshicho (a manservant doing odd jobs)

sen.j: 駆使丁
sen.e: Kushicho
Kushicho (general workers)
Kushicho (general workers)

sen.j: 供御院
sen.e: Kugoin
Kugoin (Division of rice for the Emperor)
Kugoin (Division of rice for the Emperor)

sen.j: 大炊寮の史生が｢供御院預｣として監督した。
sen.e: Shisho of oiryo controlled kugoin as kugoinazukari.
Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents) of Oiryo controlled Kugoin as Kugoin-azukari.
sen.cmt: Shishoの補足追加 (用語集)、Oiryo、Kugoin、Kugoin-azukari としました。
sen.e: Shisho (a person doing miscellaneous duties about documents) of Oiryo controlled Kugoin as Kugoin-azukari.

sen.j: 供御とは天皇の食事であり、天皇、太上天皇、東宮、中宮など皇族の食事を調理すると共に食材を準備、管理する。
sen.e: Kugo means meals for the emperor and kugoin was responsible for cooking meals for the imperial family including the emperor, retired emperors, princes and empresses, and for food preparation and management.

Kugo means meals for the emperor and kugoin was responsible for cooking meals for the imperial family including the emperor, retired emperors, princes and empresses, and for food preparation and management.

Kugo means meals for the emperor and kugoin was responsible for cooking meals for the imperial family including the emperor, retired emperors, princes and empresses, and for food preparation and management.
